result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called: 8:42 am
Includes 15CM1096 and 15CM1197.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher:
Defendant appears in person pro se;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CM1096:
Ct. 2 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)>>DRI.

15CM1197:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CM1096:
Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: $1,494 fine inclusive of Court Costs, 45 days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination to start immediately, No objection to EMP, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 24 months as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; IID installation fee to be paid; 24 months dl revocation; AODA, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Exemptions for the vehicles will be provided to the Court.

COURT adjourns matter at this time. Parties are to reset the Plea Date in about 30 days.
